availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel H. Paul (Russell County, Kentucky, blacksmith and captain in 5th Regiment Kentucky Militia)

body.p: Russell County, Kentucky, blacksmith and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of James Paul and Phoeba Judd Paul. Married to Nancy Paul. Father of Mary E. Paul, James R. Paul, Joseph Paul, and Nancy Paul. Blacksmith in Jefferson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Blacksmith in Russell County in 1860. Served in the 5th Regiment Kentucky Militia as a captain in Shelby County, Kentucky, in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District 1, p. 185B.
